summary: "Adventures of Huckleberry Finn" is a classic novel by Mark Twain, published in 1884-1885. Told by Huck Finn, it's a sequel to "The Adventures of Tom Sawyer." The book is praised for its realistic portrayal of boyhood and its colorful descriptions of life along the Mississippi River. It's also a sharp critique of racism and other societal issues. Despite its importance, the book has been criticized for using offensive language and racial terms.
title: Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
